meanings.definition: A substance used to kill germs and bacteria.
meanings.sent1: I sprayed disinfectant on the doorknobs to keep them clean.
meanings.sent2: The hospital uses a strong disinfectant to ensure a sterile environment.
meanings.sent3: The disinfectant worked its magic, making the kitchen sparkle and shine.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was like a disinfectant, brightening up the room and chasing away any gloom.
meanings.sent5: The disinfectant smelled like fresh lemons, making the whole room feel fresh and clean.

meanings.definition: To clean or sterilize an area using a disinfectant.
meanings.sent1: She carefully disinfectanted the countertops after preparing the meal.
meanings.sent2: Remember to disinfectant your hands after touching any surfaces in public places.
meanings.sent3: He disinfectanted the room so thoroughly that even the dust bunnies were afraid to linger.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter seemed to disinfectant the tension in the room, making everyone relax.
meanings.sent5: The rain came down like a disinfectant, washing away all the dirt and grime from the streets.
